person.persName: William Hercules Hays (Colonel of the 10th Kentucky Infantry and Inspector General of Kentucky)

body.p: A Kentucky attorney, solider, and judge. Educated in Washington County, Kentucky schools. He read law in Elizabethtown, Kentucky under James W. Hays and attended law lectures in Glasgow, Kentucky. Admitted to the bar in 1845 and began practice in his hometown of Springfield, Kentucky. Member of the Whig Party. Elected county judge of Washington County in 1851 and re-elected in 1854. Voted for John Bell for President in 1860. Elected and served in the Kentucky House of Representatives in 1861. Entered the service of the United States Army as a lieutenant-colonel of the 10th Kentucky Infantry in 1861. Promoted to colonel in 1862 upon the resignation of John Marshall Harlan and served until 1865. Appointed and served as Inspector-General of Kentucky from March to November 1865. Resigned his office and engaged in the oil speculation business in Cumberland River Valley.
